item.title: Rotring
item.description: Bic’s disposable Cristal ballpoint pen was first launched in 1950, and is now a ubiquitous piece of design, with its transparent hexagonal casing and it’s monochrome plastic cap ends to indicate the colour of the ink within. They are democratic design. A tool for everyone, with packet of ten costing £3.79 on Amazon.co.uk. They are, one suspects, the cause of and antidote to the pen fetishism I see expressed regularly on Twitter.
